472-d-08-21-82-ABB.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 2:16 A.M., SATURDAY MORNING, AUG. 21, 1982, THE AKRON & BARERTON BELT RAILROAD CREWCONSISTING OF ELI GOOD, ENGINEER, WALTER DEAL, FIREMAN, ROBERT H. WHITE, CONDUCTOR AND RALPH S. CARRIS AND RUDY DOMANSKI, BRAKEMEN PROCEEDED EAST ACROSS SNYDER AVE. IN BARBERTON, OHIO AT APPROXIMATELY 12 M.P.H. WITH ENGINE 1210 IN THE LEAD AND 1205 TRAILING. THE TRAIN CONSISTED OF THREE CARS AND NOCABOOSE. UNBEKNOWNST TO THE CREW, A LESLIE A. SEIFERT PROCEEDING WEST ON SYNDER AVE. STRUCK THE REAR SECTION OF THE LAST CAR IN THE TRAIN, NAHX 900082. THE CREW PROCEEDED TO THE YARD AT 43 SECOND ST,N.W. AND DISCOVERED NAHX 900082 SEVERELY DAMAGED AND LEAKING SODA ASH. CONDUCTOR WHITE CONTACTED BARBERTON POLICE WHO INFORMED HIM THE THERE HAD BEEN AN ACCIDENT AT THE SNYDER AVE. CROSSING. UPON FURTHER INVESTIGATION IT WAS DETERMINED THAT MRS. SEIFERT HAD BEEN AT A BAR ON MANCHESTER RD. AND HAD HAD AN ALTERCATION WITH HER ESTRANGED HUSBAND. SHE LEFT THE BAR AND WAS FOLLOWED BY HER HUSBAND IN ASECOND AUTOMOBILE. THE POLICE REPORT INDICATES THAT SHE DROVE THROUGH A RED LIGHT AT THE CORNER OF VAN BUREN AND SNYDER AVENUES AT THE LAST INTERSECTION PRIOR TO THE RAIL CROSSING AT A HINoneNoneNone
